results.abstract: 1st manned orbital flight, scheduled for Mar '79, seen facing delay because of recurring tech problems with reusable rocket engines; NASA Admr Dr Robert A Frosch tells Cong chances are less than 50-50 that schedule can be met; ind com of engineers, organized by Natl Research Council, says, in rept prepared for Sen Science Subcom, that current state of engine development is 'immature'; cautions NASA against pressing too hard to meet launch deadline; shuttle's engines discussed; tech features noted (M)

headline.main: SPACE SHUTTLE FACES DELAYS IN LAUNCHING; First Manned Orbital Flight May Be Put Off by Technical Problems in Development of Engines Big Gain In Rocketry A Word of Caution Testing Behind Schedule

results.snippet: The first manned orbital flight of the nation's space shuttle next year will more than likely be delayed because of recurring technical problems in the development of its reusable rocket engines.
results.lead_paragraph: The first manned orbital flight of the nation's space shuttle next year will more than likely be delayed because of recurring technical problems in the development of its reusable rocket engines.

results.abstract: Soviet physicians, after assessment of 96-day space flight by Lt Col Yuri Romanenko and Georgi M Grechko, say longer space flights are possible; problems faced by cosmonauts in readjusting to earth's gravitation described (M)

headline.main: Russians See Longer Space Trips After Tests on 2 Who Set Record; 'Head Is So Heavy' The Illusion Disappears

results.snippet: MOSCOW, April 3--After examining the two Soviet astronauts who spent a record 96 days in space, scientists and physicians believe that longer flights are possible, the Soviet press has reported.

byline.original: By DAVID K. SHIPLER Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, April 3--After examining the two Soviet astronauts who spent a record 96 days in space, scientists and physicians believe that longer flights are possible, the Soviet press has reported.

headline.main: EASTERN ACCEPTS $778 MILLION DEAL TO GET 23 AIRBUSES; Approval From Airline's Lenders Is Required--Borman Indicates This Will Be--Granted External Financing Arranged Eastern Leasing 4 Aircraft EASTERN ACCEPTS DEAL FOR AIRBUSES

headline.main: Home Beat; Friends and Furniture The Envelope, Please

results.snippet: Definitely, the scent is in the air. Not spring, you understand, but the pungent fragrance of la dolce vita. From Milan, Rome, Turin, the works of Italian designers have been pouring in. Ecco, bellissimo! The odor is heady, voluptuous --shall we say...
results.lead_paragraph: Definitely, the scent is in the air. Not spring, you understand, but the pungent fragrance of la dolce vita. From Milan, Rome, Turin, the works of Italian designers have been pouring in. Ecco, bellissimo! The odor is heady, voluptuous --shall we say even, at times, outrageous?
